TITLE: Handling playerDropped Event in C#
DESCRIPTION: This C# example shows how to handle the playerDropped event in a FiveM resource. It logs the player's name, disconnect reason, resource name, and client drop reason using Debug.WriteLine.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/scripting-reference/events/list/playerDropped.md#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
// In class constructor
EventHandlers["playerDropped"] += new Action<Player, string, string, uint>(OnPlayerDropped);

// Delegate method
private void OnPlayerDropped([FromSource]Player player, string reason, string resourceName, uint clientDropReason)
{
    Debug.WriteLine($"Player {player.Name} dropped (Reason: {reason}, Resource: {resourceName}, Client Drop Reason: {clientDropReason}).");
}
```

TITLE: Processing HUD Colors and Generating Table Rows in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code for processing HUD color data from a string input, converting RGB to hex, and generating HTML table rows. This script parses color information, handles color aliases, and creates formatted table rows for each color entry.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/game-references/hud-colors.md#2025-04-16_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
const hudColors = `[PASTE HUDCOLOR.DAT HERE]`;

function componentToHex(c) {
  var hex = c.toString(16);
  return hex.length == 1 ? "0" + hex : hex;
}

function rgbToHex(r, g, b) {
  return "#" + componentToHex(r) + componentToHex(g) + componentToHex(b);
}

colors = hudColors.split(/\n/g).filter(a => a.startsWith('HUD_')).map((line, idx) => {
    const bits = line.replace(/\s+/g, ' ').split(' ');

    if (bits[1] !== 'RGBA') {
        return {
            idx,
            name: bits[0],
            alias: bits[1],
        }
    }

    return {
        idx,
        name: bits[0],
        r: parseInt(bits[2]),
        g: parseInt(bits[3]),
        b: parseInt(bits[4]),
        a: parseInt(bits[5]),
    };
})

colorTable = Object.fromEntries(colors.map(color => [color.name, color]));

colors.map(color => {
    if (color.alias) {
        const otherColor = colorTable[color.alias];

        return `
    <tr>
        <td class="color" style="--color: rgba(${otherColor.r}, ${otherColor.g}, ${otherColor.b}, ${otherColor.a / 255})" id="${color.name.toLowerCase()}"> </td>
        <td>${color.idx}</td>
        <td>${color.name}</td>
        <td><a href="#${otherColor.name.toLowerCase()}">${otherColor.name}</a></td>
    </tr>`;
    }
    
    return `
    <tr>
        <td class="color" style="--color: rgba(${color.r}, ${color.g}, ${color.b}, ${color.a / 255})" id="${color.name.toLowerCase()}"> </td>
        <td>${color.idx}</td>
        <td>${color.name}</td>
        <td><abbr title="${rgbToHex(color.r, color.g, color.b)}">rgba(${color.r}, ${color.g}, ${color.b}, ${color.a})</abbr></td>
    </tr>`;
}).join("")
```

TITLE: Styling Weapon Display Grid in CSS
DESCRIPTION: CSS styling for a responsive grid layout that displays weapon information in card format. Includes styling for cards, images, information sections, and collapsible details elements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/game-references/weapon-models.md#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: css
CODE:
```
* { box-sizing: border-box; }
body { margin: 0; overflow-x: hidden; }
.category { margin-bottom: 40px; }
.category h2 { text-align: left; margin-top: 30px; margin-bottom: 10px; padding-left: 20px; }
.weapons { display: flex; flex-wrap: wrap; gap: 20px; padding: 20px; }
.weapon { background: #FFF; color: #000; border: 1px solid #CCC; border-radius: 8px; overflow: hidden; box-shadow: 0 2px 5px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); transition: box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out; font-family: 'Segoe UI', Tahoma, Geneva, Verdana, sans-serif; display: flex; flex-direction: column; justify-content: space-between; height: 100%; min-width: 220px; max-width: 300px; }
.weapon img { width: 100%; height: 100px; object-fit: scale-down; display: block; padding: 10px; border-radius: 8px; }
.weapon-info { padding: 5px 10px; font-size: 0.8em; background: #F7F7F7; border-top: 1px solid #DDD; color: #333; text-align: left; display: flex; flex-direction: column; justify-content: center; align-items: flex-start; flex-grow: 1; }
.weapon-info span.hash-key { white-space:normal; max-width: 300px; }
.weapon-info span.weapon-description { white-space:normal; max-width: 220px; }
.weapon-info span { margin: 2px 0; }
.weapon-info span:last-child { margin-bottom: 0; }
.components, .tints { margin-top: 10px; }
.no-image { text-align: center; padding: 20px; background: #f0f0f0; color: #666; font-style: italic; border: 1px solid #ccc; border-radius: 8px; }
details { cursor: pointer; font-weight: bold; background: #F7F7F7; border-top: 1px solid #DDD; margin-top: 10px; padding: 5px; width: 200px; overflow-x: auto; }
summary { margin: 0; padding: 5px; }
```

TITLE: Handling onClientResourceStop Event in C#
DESCRIPTION: This C# code snippet shows how to register an event handler for onClientResourceStop in a class constructor and define a delegate method to handle the event. It prints the name of the stopped resource using Debug.WriteLine.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/scripting-reference/events/list/onClientResourceStop.md#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
// In class constructor
EventHandlers["onClientResourceStop"] += new Action<string>(OnClientResourceStop);

// Delegate method
private void OnClientResourceStop(string resourceName)
{
    Debug.WriteLine($"The resource {resourceName} has been stopped on the client.");
}
```

TITLE: Callback Function in Citizen.re Pattern Matching for FiveM (Lua)
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates using a callback function with Citizen.re to process multiple pattern matches. The callback is called for each occurrence of the pattern found in memory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/scripting-reference/runtimes/javascript/functions/RegisterNetEvent.md#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
local count = 0

memory.scan(0, "-1", "48 8B 05 ${offset}[4] 48 8B 08 33 D2", function(addr, captures)
    count = count + 1
    local capture = memory.rebase(tonumber(captures.offset, 16))
    local value = memory.read_int(capture)
    print(string.format('Match %d: Captured value: %d', count, value))
    return true -- continue scanning
end)

print('Total matches found: ' .. count)
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/developers/sandbox.md#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
-- Using mount paths (recommended)

local files2 = io.readdir("@myResource/assets")

-- Using absolute paths
local files3 = io.readdir("/absolute/path/to/resource")
local files4 = io.readdir("/absolute/path/to/resource/assets")
```

TITLE: Configuring Nginx for Connect Proxy
DESCRIPTION: This nginx configuration sets up a reverse proxy for the connect endpoint of a Cfx.re server. It includes SSL configuration, proxy settings, and an optional caching setup for file serving.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/server-manual/proxy-setup.md#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: nginx
CODE:
```
upstream backend {
    # use the actual server IP here, or if separate, a proxy server
    server 100.64.1.2:30120;
}

# assuming this path exists
proxy_cache_path /srv/cache levels=1:2 keys_zone=assets:48m max_size=20g inactive=2h;

server {
    listen 443 ssl http2;
    listen [::]:443 ssl http2;

    server_name server1.example.com;

    # this can also be a Cloudflare origin certificate if you're using CF
    ssl_certificate /path/to/certificate.pem;
    ssl_certificate_key /path/to/privkey.pem;

    location / {
        proxy_set_header Host $host;
        proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $remote_addr;
        # required to pass auth headers correctly
        proxy_pass_request_headers on;
        # required to not make deferrals close the connection instantly
        proxy_http_version 1.1;
        proxy_pass http://backend;
    }

    # extra block for a caching proxy
    location /files/ {
        proxy_pass http://backend$request_uri;
        add_header X-Cache-Status $upstream_cache_status;
        proxy_cache_lock on;
        proxy_cache assets;
        proxy_cache_valid 1y;
        proxy_cache_key $request_uri$is_args$args;
        proxy_cache_revalidate on;
        proxy_cache_min_uses 1;
    }
}
```

TITLE: Handling onClientResourceStop Event in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript code snippet demonstrates how to handle the onClientResourceStop event. It checks if the stopped resource is the current resource and logs a message to the console if it is.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/scripting-reference/events/list/onClientResourceStop.md#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
on("onClientResourceStop", (resourceName) => {
  if(GetCurrentResourceName() != resourceName) {
    return;
  }

  console.log(`The resource ${resourceName} has been stopped on the client.`)
});
```

TITLE: Adding Multiple Command Suggestions to Chat in Lua
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the chat:addSuggestions event to add multiple command suggestions to the FiveM chat interface. It adds suggestions for '/command' and '/othercommand', each with their own help text and parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/resources/chat/events/chat-addSuggestions.md#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
TriggerEvent('chat:addSuggestions', {
    {
        name='/command',
        help='help text',
        params={
            { name="paramName1", help="param description 1" },
            { name="paramName2", help="param description 2" }
        }
    },
    {
        name='/othercommand',
        help='other help text',
        params={
            { name="otherParamName1", help="other param description 1" },
            { name="otherParamName2", help="other param description 2" }
        }
    },
})
```

TITLE: Preventing Resource Start in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript version of the resource start prevention handler using the on() function to listen for the onResourceStarting event and cancel it when needed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/scripting-reference/events/list/onResourceStarting.md#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
on("onResourceStarting", (resourceName) => {
  if (resourceName === "pineapple") {
    CancelEvent();
  }
});
```

TITLE: Enabling Full Memory Dumps in CitizenFX.ini

LANGUAGE: ini
CODE:
```
EnableFullMemoryDump=0
```

TITLE: Setting and Getting Server Replicated Convars in Lua for FiveM
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to set and get server replicated convar values using Lua in FiveM resources. SetConvarReplicated is used to set a value, while GetConvar retrieves the value.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/scripting-reference/convars/_index.md#2025-04-16_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
SetConvarReplicated("convar_name", "convar value")
```

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
local convarValue = GetConvar("convar_name", "Default convar value.")
```

TITLE: Disabling Windows Version Check in CitizenFX.ini
DESCRIPTION: Configuration to disable the Windows version compatibility check. By default, FiveM checks if you're using a supported version of Windows 10 (minimum version 1703).
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/client-manual/citizenfx.md#2025-04-16_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: ini
CODE:
```
DisableOSVersionCheck=0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Styling Grid Layout for Ped Models Display
DESCRIPTION: CSS styling for creating a responsive grid layout to display ped model information with images and details. Includes styling for model containers, images, and text formatting.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/game-references/ped-models.md#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: css
CODE:
```
	.models {
		display: grid;
		grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fill, 12%);
	}

	.model {
		padding: 5px;
		margin: 5px;

		border: 1px solid #333;
		background-color: #fafafa;

		position: relative;
	}

	.model span {
		display: block;
		text-align: center;
		bottom: 5px;
		left: 5px;
		right: 5px;
		word-wrap: break-word;
	}

	.model img {
		max-height: 150px;
	}
```

| Flag Number | Flag Name | Description | Build Introduced |
|-------------|-----------|-------------|-------------------|

| 1 | FLAG_BIG | Peds driving the vehicle will take wider turns, increase space between traffic, and avoid ramming during chases. |  |
```

TITLE: Squashing Commits Using Git Rebase Command in CLI
DESCRIPTION: This command initiates an interactive rebase that allows squashing the 3 most recent commits. It opens a text editor where users can change 'pick' to 'squash' for the commits they want to combine with the previous one.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/contributing/git/squash-guide.md#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git rebase -i HEAD~3
```

TITLE: Defining CSS styling for checkpoint display grid in HTML
DESCRIPTION: CSS styling for creating a responsive grid layout to display checkpoint images. The style creates a grid with multiple columns, formats individual checkpoint containers with borders and backgrounds, and handles text alignment and image sizing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/game-references/checkpoints.md#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: css
CODE:
```
.checkpoints {
    display:grid;
    grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fill, 16.4%);
}

.checkpoint {
    padding: 2.5px;
    margin: 2.5px;
    border: 1px solid #333;
    background-color: #fafafa;
    position: relative
}

.checkpoint span {
    display: block;
    text-align: center;
    bottom: 2.5px;
    left: 2.5px;
    right: 2.5px;
    word-wrap: break-word;
}

.checkpoint img {
    max-height: 300px;
}
```

TITLE: HTML Structured Ped Model Documentation
DESCRIPTION: HTML markup for displaying ped model information including images, model names, prop counts and component counts. The models are organized into service/military characters and story characters sections.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/game-references/ped-models.md#2025-04-16_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<div class="model"><span><img src="/peds/s_m_y_cop_01.webp" loading="lazy" alt="s_m_y_cop_01"><br><strong>s_m_y_cop_01</strong><br>2 props<br>6 components</span></div>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Linux Server Installation Commands
DESCRIPTION: Commands for running the FXServer on Linux systems, including changing to the server-data directory and executing the server with a configuration file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/server-manual/setting-up-a-server-vanilla.md#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
cd ~/FXServer/server-data && bash ~/FXServer/server/run.sh +exec server.cfg
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying GTA V Map Blip Icons in HTML
DESCRIPTION: HTML markup for displaying map blip icons with their corresponding ID numbers and names. Each blip is represented as a div containing an image and accompanying text label.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/game-references/blips.md#2025-04-16_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: HTML
CODE:
```
<div class="blip"><div><div><img src="/blips/radar_weapon_minigun.png" alt="radar_weapon_minigun"></div></div><span><strong>173</strong><br>radar_weapon_minigun</span></div>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checkpoint Marker HTML Structure
DESCRIPTION: HTML structure for displaying checkpoint markers with images, numbers, and marker IDs. Each checkpoint is contained in a div with class 'checkpoint' and includes an image, checkpoint number, and corresponding marker ID.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/game-references/checkpoints.md#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<div class="checkpoint"><span><img src="/checkpoints/44-118.png" alt="118"><br><strong>118</strong><br>Marker ID 21</span></div>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Convar Category Schema
DESCRIPTION: Shows the general schema structure for defining a convar category in the fxmanifest.lua file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/fxdk/resources.md#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
convar_category 'Category name' {
    'Category description', -- required entry, so don't miss it
    {
        ... -- convar entries
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Weapon Documentation HTML Structure
DESCRIPTION: HTML markup defining the structure for weapon documentation including weapon details, components, and customization options for various shotgun types in FiveM.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/game-references/weapon-models.md#2025-04-16_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<div class="weapon">
  <img src="/weapons/WEAPON_PUMPSHOTGUN.png" alt="Pump Shotgun">
  <div class="weapon-info">
    <span><strong>Name:</strong> Pump Shotgun</span>
    <span class='hash-key'><strong>Hash:</strong> WEAPON_PUMPSHOTGUN</span>
    <span><strong>Model Hash Key:</strong> w_sg_pumpshotgun</span>
    <span><strong>DLC:</strong> core</span>
    <span class='weapon-description'><strong>Description:</strong> Standard shotgun ideal for short-range combat.</span>
    <div class="components">
      <details>
        <summary>Components</summary>
        <ul>
          <li title='Flashlight'>COMPONENT_AT_AR_FLSH</li>
          <li title='Suppressor'>COMPONENT_AT_SR_SUPP</li>
        </ul>
      </details>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>
```

TITLE: HTML Structure for Train Vehicle Documentation
DESCRIPTION: HTML markup defining the structure and layout for train vehicle documentation, including images and vehicle information like display names, hash values, and model names.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/game-references/vehicle-references/vehicle-models.md#2025-04-16_snippet_25

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<div class="category" id="trains">
    <div class="vehicles">
        <div class="vehicle">
            <img src="/vehicles/cablecar.webp" alt="Cable Car">
            <div class="vehicle-info">
                <span><strong>Display Name:</strong> Cable Car</span>
                <span><strong>Hash:</strong> 3334677549</span>
                <span><strong>Model Name:</strong> cablecar</span>
            </div>
        </div>
        <!-- Additional train vehicles... -->
    </div>
</div>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Chat:addTemplate Parameters
DESCRIPTION: The required parameters for the chat:addTemplate event. It takes a template ID string and an HTML string that defines the template format.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/resources/chat/events/chat-addTemplate.md#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
string templateID, string htmlString
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Event Name Definition for baseevents:enteringAborted in FiveM
DESCRIPTION: Defines the name of the enteringAborted event in the baseevents namespace. This event is likely triggered when a player aborts entering a vehicle in FiveM.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/resources/baseevents/events/enteringAborted.md#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
baseevents:enteringAborted
```

TITLE: Configuring Nginx for Server Proxy
DESCRIPTION: This nginx configuration sets up a raw TCP/UDP proxy for the server endpoint of a Cfx.re server. It uses the Nginx 'stream' module to forward both TCP and UDP traffic on port 30120.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/server-manual/proxy-setup.md#2025-04-16_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: nginx
CODE:
```
stream {
    upstream backend {
        server 100.64.1.2:30120;
    }
    server {
		listen 30120;
		proxy_pass backend;
	}
	server {
		listen 30120 udp reuseport;
		proxy_pass backend;
	}
}
```

TITLE: Styling for Vehicle Model Display in HTML/CSS
DESCRIPTION: CSS styling for a responsive grid layout that displays vehicle information cards. The styling includes card design, image formatting, and text layout for vehicle information cards organized by categories.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/game-references/vehicle-references/vehicle-models.md#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: css
CODE:
```
* {
        box-sizing: border-box;
    }

    body {
        margin: 0;
        overflow-x: hidden;
    }

    .category {
        margin-bottom: 40px;
    }

    .category h2 {
        text-align: left;
        margin-top: 30px;
        margin-bottom: 10px;
        padding-left: 20px;
    }

    .vehicles {
        display: grid;
        grid-template-columns: repeat(4, 180px);
        gap: 20px;
        padding: 20px;
        align-items: start;
        margin: auto;
    }

    .vehicle {
        background: #FFF;
        color: #000;
        border: 1px solid #CCC;
        border-radius: 8px;
        overflow: hidden;
        box-shadow: 0 2px 5px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
        transition: box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
        font-family: 'Segoe UI', Tahoma, Geneva, Verdana, sans-serif;
        display: flex;
        flex-direction: column;
        justify-content: space-between;
        height: 100%;
    }

    .vehicle img {
        width: 100%;
        height: 100px;
        object-fit: scale-down;
        display: block;
        padding: 10px;
        border-radius: 8px;
    }

    .vehicle-info {
        padding: 5px 10px;
        font-size: 0.8em;
        background: #F7F7F7;
        border-top: 1px solid #DDD;
        color: #333;
        text-align: left;
        display: flex;
        flex-direction: column;
        justify-content: center;
        align-items: flex-start;
        flex-grow: 1;
    }

    .vehicle-info span {
        margin: 2px 0;
    }

    .vehicle-info span:last-child {
        margin-bottom: 0;
    }
```

TITLE: INSTRUCTIONAL_BUTTONS Scaleform Method Reference
DESCRIPTION: Comprehensive list of available methods for the INSTRUCTIONAL_BUTTONS Scaleform including button manipulation, text settings, positioning, and visual customization. Methods cover functionality from toggling mouse buttons to setting backgrounds and managing button layouts.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/game-references/instructional-buttons.md#2025-04-16_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
TOGGLE_MOUSE_BUTTONS(bool toggle)
Toggles clickable buttons

SET_SAVING_TEXT(int iconEnum, string saveStr)
Sets a text with loading icon

REMOVE_SAVING()
Removes the loading icon text

CLEAR_ALL()
Clears all instructional button slots

CLEAR_RENDER()
Stops rendering buttons

OVERRIDE_POSITION(float x, float y, bool alignBottomRight)
Overrides buttons' position.

SET_CLEAR_SPACE(float clearSpace)

SET_DATA_SLOT(int index, any icon, string text, bool clickable, int controlIndex)
Adds a button slot. You can add up to 20 icons, those can be either input strings (e.g ~INPUT_FRONTEND_ACCEPT~ for enter) or icon id's.
Note: Make sure to not add last two parameters if TOGGLE_MOUSE_BUTTONS is FALSE to prevent glitchy buttons.

SET_DATA_SLOT_EMPTY()
Alias for CLEAR_ALL()

CLEAR_BACKGROUNDS()
Removes background for the buttons.

DRAW_INSTRUCTIONAL_BUTTONS(int layoutType)
Sets buttons to be drawn.

GET_NUMBER_OF_ROWS()
Returns number of rows. Note: You need to use scaleform movie method return value natives for this.

SET_BACKGROUND()
Adds background.

SET_PADDING(int top, int right, int bottom, int left)

SET_BACKGROUND_COLOUR(int r, int g, int b, int a)
Overrides background colour.

OVERRIDE_RESPAWN_TEXT(int index, string text)
Overrides text for a button.

FLASH_BUTTON_BY_ID(int buttonID, int alpha, int duration)
Flashes a button

SET_MAX_WIDTH(float maxWidth)
Sets max width for buttons. This prevents buttons from being off-screen if there are too many data slots set. Instead, they will stack up.

SET_HIT_AREA_VISIBLE(bool isVisible)
Shows debug hit area for mouse visible. This hit area is used for native 0x3d9acb1eb139e702, which returns wether or not the mouse cursor is above instructional buttons if TOGGLE_MOUSE_BUTTONS is true.
```

TITLE: Styling Blips Grid Display with CSS
DESCRIPTION: CSS styling for displaying blips in a responsive grid format. Defines the layout, appearance, and formatting for blip items including containers, images, and text elements. The styles handle positioning, sizing, borders, backgrounds, and text overflow for a consistent display.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/game-references/blips.md#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: CSS
CODE:
```
.blips {
    display: grid;
    grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fill, calc(100% / 8));
}

.blip {
    padding: 5px;
    margin: 5px;

    border: 1px solid #333;
    background-color: #d4d4d4;

    position: relative;

    justify-content: center;
    flex-direction: column;
    display: flex;
}

.blip > div {
    text-align: center;
    flex-grow: 1;

    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    justify-content: center;
}

.blip span {
    display: block;
    text-align: center;
    font-size: 10px;
    overflow: hidden;
    text-overflow: ellipsis;
}

.blip strong {
    font-size: 12px;
}

.blip img {
    max-height: 36px;
}

.blip_color {
    height: 80px;
}

.blip-colors .blip span {
    position: absolute;
    display: block;
    text-align: center;
    bottom: 5px;
    left: 5px;
    right: 5px;
}

.blip.bcolor {
    background-color: #fafafa;
}
```

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
netPort 30120

TITLE: Removing Principal Inheritance in FiveM/RedM
DESCRIPTION: Removes a specified principal inheritance entry, breaking the permission inheritance relationship between the child and parent principals.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/server-manual/server-commands.md#2025-04-16_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
remove_principal identifier.steam:110000112345678 group.admin
```

TITLE: Setting Auto Spawn Callback in Lua for FiveM
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the setAutoSpawnCallback export to define custom spawning behavior for players. It includes logic for different spawn scenarios based on whether it's the player's first spawn or a respawn.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/resources/spawnmanager/functions/setAutoSpawnCallback.md#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
local firstSpawn = true
exports.spawnmanager:setAutoSpawnCallback(function()
    if firstSpawn then
        -- Spawn them at the spawnpoint
        exports.spawnmanager:spawnPlayer({
            x = 466.8401,
            y = 197.7201,
            z = 111.5291,
            heading = 291.71,
            model = 'a_m_m_farmer_01',
            skipFade = false
        })
        firstSpawn = false
    else
        -- Respawn them at the hospital
        exports.spawnmanager:spawnPlayer({
            x = 354.09,
            y = -603.54,
            z = 28.78,
            heading = 260.0,
            skipFade = false
             -- 'model' is left out here so that their ped model is preserved
        }, function(spawn)
            ClearPedBloodDamage(PlayerPedId())
        end)
    end
end)
exports.spawnmanager:setAutoSpawn(true)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Self-Signed SSL Certificate for Windows
DESCRIPTION: This command generates a self-signed SSL certificate for use with nginx on Windows systems. It creates a 2048-bit RSA key and a certificate valid for 365 days.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/server-manual/proxy-setup.md#2025-04-16_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
openssl req -x509 -nodes -days 365 -newkey rsa:2048 -keyout nginx-selfsigned.key -out nginx-selfsigned.crt
```

TITLE: Blocking Port 30121 using Linux iptables
DESCRIPTION: Uses iptables to block incoming TCP traffic on port 30121. Requires root privileges via sudo.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/server-manual/proxy-setup.md#2025-04-16_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
sudo iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 30121 -j DROP
```

TITLE: Defining onDataFileEntry Event Data Interface in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: This TypeScript interface defines the structure of the data provided to the onDataFileEntry event. It includes properties for the event name, data file entry name, type, and whether it's new.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/scripting-manual/nui-development/loading-screens/onDataFileEntry.md#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
interface EventData {
    eventName: 'onDataFileEntry',
    name: string,
    type: number,
    isNew: boolean,
}
```

TITLE: Implementing String Splitting in Lua for FiveM Server
DESCRIPTION: Provides a Lua implementation of string splitting to replace the deprecated str:Split method.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/server-manual/migrating-from-citmp.md#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
function stringsplit(inputstr, sep)
    if sep == nil then
        sep = "%s"
    end
    local t={} ; i=1
    for str in string.gmatch(inputstr, "([^"..sep.."])+") do
        t[i] = str
        i = i + 1
    end
    return t
end
```

TITLE: Parsing CSectorPositionDataNode in C++
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to parse the CSectorPositionDataNode, which is used to share sector position data for entities in OneSync. It deserializes incoming data for entity positions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/scripting-reference/onesync/_index.md#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: cpp
CODE:
```
struct CSectorPositionDataNode
{
	float m_posX;
	float m_posY;
	float m_posZ;

    // Parse/deserialize incoming data
	bool Parse(SyncParseState& state)
	{
		auto posX = state.buffer.ReadFloat(12, 54.0f);
		auto posY = state.buffer.ReadFloat(12, 54.0f);
		auto posZ = state.buffer.ReadFloat(12, 69.0f);

		m_posX = posX;
		m_posY = posY;
		m_posZ = posZ;

		state.entity->syncTree->CalculatePosition();

		return true;
	}

    // continues...
};
```

TITLE: Named Captures in Citizen.re Pattern Matching for FiveM (Lua)
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use named captures in Citizen.re patterns to extract specific values from memory. This example captures a 32-bit integer and prints its value.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/scripting-reference/runtimes/javascript/functions/RegisterNetEvent.md#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
local result = memory.scan(0, "-1", "48 8B 05 ${offset}[4] 48 8B 08 33 D2")

if result then
    local capture = memory.rebase(tonumber(result.offset, 16))
    local value = memory.read_int(capture)
    print('Captured value: ' .. value)
else
    print('Pattern not found')
end
```

TITLE: Alternative Event Handler Implementation
DESCRIPTION: Alternative approach using separate RegisterNetEvent and AddEventHandler calls.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/scripting-reference/runtimes/lua/functions/TriggerServerEvent.md#2025-04-16_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
RegisterNetEvent('myCustomServerEvent')
AddEventHandler('myCustomServerEvent', function(name, score)
    print(string.format('Player %s has a new score of %d', name, score))
end)
```

TITLE: Setting Wanted Level in Gamer Tags for Lua and C#
DESCRIPTION: These snippets show how to set the wanted level displayed in the gamer tag's wanted star icon. The wanted level ranges from 0 to 5.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/game-references/gamer-tags.md#2025-04-16_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
-- Set the number that will be set inside the wanted star icon
SetMpGamerTagWantedLevel(
  gamerTagId,
  wantedLevel -- 0 - 5
)
```

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
// Set the number that will be set inside the wanted star icon
Function.Call(
  Hash._SET_HEAD_DISPLAY_WANTED,
  (int)gamerTagId,
  (int)wantedLevel // 0 - 5
);
```

TITLE: Intercepting Ped Creation in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript implementation for intercepting ped creation and modifying the model and position. Similar to the Lua example, it changes the ped model to a police officer and adjusts the spawn height.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/scripting-reference/events/list/populationPedCreating.md#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
setImmediate(() => {
  RequestModel('s_m_y_cop_01')
})

on('populationPedCreating', (x, y, z, model, setters) => {
    console.log(`Making cop at ${x} ${y} ${z} plus a bit (${model})`);
    setters.setModel('s_m_y_cop_01') // you can use a hash as well
    setters.setPosition(x, y, z + 5.5)
})
```

TITLE: Handling playerConnecting Event without Deferrals in Lua
DESCRIPTION: This Lua example demonstrates how to handle the playerConnecting event without using deferrals. It checks for a Steam identifier and cancels the event if not found.
SOURCE: https://github.com/citizenfx/fivem-docs/blob/master/content/docs/scripting-reference/events/list/playerConnecting.md#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
local function OnPlayerConnecting(name, setKickReason, deferrals)
    local player = source
    local steamIdentifier
    local identifiers = GetPlayerIdentifiers(player)

    for _, v in pairs(identifiers) do
        if string.find(v, "steam") then
            steamIdentifier = v
            break
        end
    end

    if not steamIdentifier then
        CancelEvent()
        setKickReason("You are not connected to Steam.")
    end
end

AddEventHandler("playerConnecting", OnPlayerConnecting)
```
